content: SIX! Sri Lanka go 1-0 in the 3-match series! That's a shot and a half and a worthy hit to finish off the game! Slower full ball moving away on middle, Charith Asalanka stands still in his crease and tonks this one way over long on for a biggie. SRI LANKA WIN BY 7 WICKETS!
Full toss on off, pushed down to long on for a single.
Full on middle leg, almost a yorker. Asalanka digs it out as he plays the flick onto his pads and towards short mid-wicket. Singl taken.
Full slower delivery moving away, outside off, Asalanka is already through the slog as he is deceived by this slower delivery.
Short ball aimed at the body, Asalanka ducks under it as he lets this one go.
Fullish ball on middle, Fernando flicks this one wide of short mid-wicket for a single.

Full on off, Fernando drives this to mid off and sets off for a quick single. The mid off fielder fires in a throw at the non-striker's end and misses as Fernando eventually gets home safely. Oh, a direct hit would have been interesting.
Full on middle, Avishka flicks this one to short mid-wicket.
Length ball on off, Avishka defends it right under his eyes.
Back of a length. well outside off, Asalanka cuts it square of the wicket for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Oh, what a catch! Shamim Hossain has plucked this out of thin air! Kusal Mendis's superb knock comes to an end! Mohammad Saifuddin bowls this one on full, on middle leg, Mendis is early in his flick as the ball takes the leading edge of his bat and goes wide of short cover, who runs to his left and jumps in the air to his left, with the left hand fully stretching. The ball sticks in his hand. Oh, this is a fine, fine catch!
Kusal Mendis (wk) c S Hossain b M Saifuddin 73 (51b 5x4 3x6)
Back of a length off cutter on middle, Fernando shuffles across and works it down to deep fine leg for a single.
Short and turning away, well outside off, Mendis looks to play the cut and misses.
From round the wicket, a low full toss on off, Mendis sweeps this one in the gap between long on and deep mid-wicket for two runs.

FOUR! Nicely done! Slower through the air, shorter in length, googly, outside off, Mendis sitting deep in his crease plays the late cut fine of the short third fielder who runs to his left but can't get to the ball. The ball eventually evades him and runs down to the deep third fence for four.
A touch short on off, Fernando cuts it along the ground to the right of deep point for a single.
Overpitched on off, Mendis leans forward and drives this to the left of long off for a single.
Short length googly, on middle, Fernando punches it off the back foot to deep extra cover for a single.

Overpitched on off, Mendis drives this one wide of mid off who runs to his left but misfields the ball as it goes through his legs. Tanzim Hasan Sakib is the culprit. The batters come back for two till the time Sakib runs behind the ball and cuts it off.
Length on middle, Fernando flicks it along the ground to deep fine leg for a single.
Slower bouncer on off, Mendis plays the upper cut on the bounce to deep third man for a single.
Full on off, Mendis crunches the drive to the left of mid off who makes a good stop.

FOUR! Easy pickings! Back of the hand, slower one that lands on back of length and sliding down leg, Mendis goes a touch deep in his crease and plays the pick up over short fine leg for a one bounce four.
Length ball on leg, Avishka shuffles a bit and flicks it to the right of short cover for a single.

Just 3 off this over and now, Sri Lanka need 26 off 30 balls. Is there still hope for Bangladesh? Flighted ball on middle, drifts in, Kusal Mendis leans on to push but gets a leading edge well in front of mid off.
A tad bit short and outside off, Mendis backs away and taps it down to point.
Slow and into the pitch around off, this one sticks in the deck. Avishka Fernando hops back and tucks it away wide of long on for just one more.
Full and drifting onto the stumps, Mendis lunges and pushes it down to long off for one more.
Tossed up outside off, hit away wide of long off for a single.
Very full and outside off, it is the googly, Avishka plays it back to the bowler.

Lovely shot! Full and on off, Kusal Mendis leans on and shows the full face of the bat, driving it back past the bowler. The fielder at mid off dives to his right but is beaten but the fielder at long on is able to mop it up. Two taken.
Banged in short and outside off, Fernando reaches out and ramps it fine of deep third but the fielder is quick to get across to his left and keeps it down to a single
Back of a length and around off, angling in, Avishka Fernando gets inside the line and flicks it to mid-wicket.
Good-length delivery, darted into middle and off, Fernando watchfully blocks it off.
Banged in well short around off, slower too, Mendis gets on top of the bounce and hits the pull down through square leg for a single.
Length ball wide of the off stump, Kusal Mendis leans into the drive and hits it well in front of sweeper cover for a couple of runs.
Fuller in length and outside off, driven straight to covers.

OUT! CAUGHT! Rishad Hossain picks up a wicket but probably just a consolation one. Rishad loops it up nicely and gets the ball above the eyeliner of the batter. The ball pitches on off but dips and is the googly as well. Kusal Perera goes down to sweep and doesn't pick the googly, ending up getting a top edge that comes down near the short mid-wicket region. The keeper, Litton Das calls for it and takes it with ease.
Kusal Perera c L Das b R Hossain 24 (25b 2x4 1x6)
Floated up around middle, blocked back to the bowler.
Flatter ball outside off, Perera brings out the reverse sweep but misses. It was the googly that just turned away from the bat.
Shortish length on off, Mendis shovels the pull towards deep mid-wicket and rotates the striker once again.
Tossed up, outside off, Kusal Perera gets down on one knee and swats the slog sweep along the turf to deep mid-wicket for a run.

Good length around midle and leg, Perera looks to block but the ball nips in and takes the inside edge. The ball gets deflected off the pads to short third and they get a single. The scoring rate has slowed down in the last 2 overs but Sri Lanka are well ahead in the game, needing 37 off 48 balls.
A slower bouncer outside off, Mendis waits and taps it away down to deep third for yet another single.
Short ball over middle and leg, Kusal Perera pulls it a bit uppishly and down to long leg for one more.
A low full toss now on off, drilled down through mid off for a single.
Good length around off, Mendis looks to play at it but gets an inside edge onto the pads.
Slower and into the pitch, bowled at around just 90 kph and well outside off. Kusal Mendis has to really reach for it and just about manages to tap it to short extra cover.

Nicely played and that will be FIFTY for Kusal Mendis, his 16th in T20Is and he's got there in just 31 balls. Flatter and angled across off, Mendis stays back and angles it away behind point for a single. He gets a warm applause from the crowd and the dug out as well.
On the shorter side and on middle, Kusal Perera rocks back to pull but doesn't time it quite well. The ball goes to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Fuller and quicker around leg, flicked away to deep backward square leg for a single.
Excellent bowling and Kusal Mendis is getting bogged down here after a thunderous start. Flighted again, around middle, Mendis blocks it with a lunge again.
Flighted ball on middle and leg, nagging length as well, Mendis lunges and clips it across to mid-wicket.
Flatter from around the wicket, angled across off. Mendis baks away and cuts it straight to covers.
Short and on leg, Mendis pulls it behind square along the ground for a single.
Short length leg-break on off, Mendis moves away and guides it to backward point.
Short and well outside off, Perera cuts it to deep point for a single.
FOUR! Poor bowling from Rishad Hossain! Short and on leg, Perera shuffles across and laps this one behind the wickets fine of deep fine leg for four.
Tossed up on off, Perera hangs back and defends it back at the bowler.
FOUR! Cheeky! Tossed up around off, Perera makes some room and plays the late cut wide of first slip and fine of short third for a boundary.
Bowled from wide of the crease, fuller on middle, Perera looks to defend off the front foot and gets an inside edge that goes wide of short mid-wicket. Single taken.
Tossed up, around off, Perera leans and plays a push to backward point.
Flat and quick from Mehidy, on middle, Perera punches it straight to cover-point.
Flighted delivery on off, Perera steers it with an open face to backward point.
Tossed up around off, Perera pushes it to point.
Tossed up on leg, Mendis works it through mid-wicket for a single.
Short of a length, Mendis rocks back and plays a short-arm jab wide of deep mid-wicket. This time the fielder covers it well and keeps it down to a single.
Excellent running! At the stumps, Kusal Mendis works it away towards deep mid-wicket and gets it in front of the man in the deep and just races back for the second run.
Quick and flat, fired in towards middle and leg, Perera stsya back and dabs it away through mid-wicket for a single.
SIX! Tossed up on off, Perera gets down on one knee, switches over and plays the revers sweeps it over backward point for a maximum.
Tossed up, outside off, Perera pushes it off the back foot to point.
Short on leg. Mendis pulls it behind square for a single. Oh, that one landed just short of Rishad Hossain in the deep.
A touch short on middle, Mendis rocks back and plays the pull along the ground to the left of deep mid-wicket for a single to keep the strike.
Full on middle leg. Flicked straight to short mid-wicket.
Short and on off, Perea rocks back and cuts it in front of square to deep extra cover for a single.
Tossed up on middle. Kusal Mendis flicks it into the gap wide of short mid-wicket for a single.
Full and outside off, Mendis works it through mid-wicket for a single.
Short and on off, Mendis cuts it behind square to the left of deep point for two runs.
Good length on middle, Mendis flicks it to square leg for a single.
A low full toss on middle, Perera chip it in the air over short mid-wicket for a single.
On a length and around off, Mendis flicks it to square leg for a single.

Full and around off, Kusal Perera goes for the drive off the front foot and gets an inside edge that goes behind the stumps. Kusal Mendis gives a quick call for a single and sets off. Keeper, too, runs quickly towards the ball and fires in a throw at the striker's end but misses. Kusal Mendis nonetheless would have gotten home.
Back of a length, seaming away, outside off, Perera goes for the pull and hits it off the toe end as the ball goes rolling along the ground to short mid-wicket.
Length ball pulled along the ground to the right of long on for a single.
Nicely flighted, around off again, Perera leans on and makes another block.
Tossed up around off, Kusal Perera defends it off.

OUT! CAUGHT! Oh, a rare false stroke and Mehidy Hasan Miraz gets the breakthrough for Bangladesh. Comes around the wicket and slides the ball across the off stump. Pathum Nissanka sits down and looks to get under it and swings across the line. Nissanka ends up slicing it high up and in front of mid on. Rishad Hossain comes charging in from the edge of the ring and slides to to take the catch.
Pathum Nissanka c R Hossain b MH Miraz 42 (16b 5x4 3x6)
SIX! Nice use of the feet from Nissanka! Flighted ball at the stumps, Pathum Nissanka advances and keeps his shape before lofting it straight over the bowler's head for anothersix.
Flatter one on middle, Nissanka presses back and pushes it away wide of long on for a couple of easy runs.

SIX! That is a gift from Mehidy Hasan Miraz to begin with. Slow and short, drifting onto the pads. Pathum Nissanka has all the time in the world to rock back and pull it over deep backward square leg for a biggie.
Full and straight, tailing back in ever so slightly. Nissanka drives it down to long on for a single.
Slower one, on a length and in the channel, Nissanka waits back and dabs it down to short third.
Oh, a single! That's disappointing given the way the Lankan openers are going about their business. A straight yorker, Mendis digs it out through mid on and picks up a run.

SIX! Wowza, Kusal Mendis is in some form! Slower delivery, on a length and on off and middle, Mendis picks it up, gets inside the line and sweeps it away over deep square leg for a biggie. 16 off the first 3 balls.

FOUR! It's like there are no fielders on the ground! Fractionally short and just wide outside off, Kusal Mendis shows quick hands to cut it away and the ball races away between point and short third for another boundary.

SIX! This is very ordinary bowling but that is some shot! A low full toss, straight at the stumps, Kusal Mendis gets low and clobbers it away over cow corner for another biggie. The 50 comes up for Sri Lanka in just 19 legal deliveries.

FOUR! Stand and deliver! Short of a length and wide outside off, Pathum Nissanka stays upright and throws his arms at it, spanking the ball through covers for another boundary. 16 off it and Sri Lanka are 46/0 in just 3 overs!

FOUR! Fortune favoring the brave here! Hard length around off, no foot movement from Nissanka as he tries to hoick it away and gets an inside edge past the leg stump and the ball runs away into the fine leg fence.

SIX! That's been bludgeoned away! Slower again, right in the slot and around off. Pathum Nissanka sets up deep in the crease and wwhacks it a long way over long on for a biggie. That has gone 91 meters.
Back of a length and over middle, Nissanka looks to hoick it over backward square leg but misses, wearing it on the mid riff.
Pitched up on a fuller length and around off, Mendis drives it away but the fielder at extra cover dives to his right and deflects it to mid off. Just a single.
Starts off with a slow short ball at the bodyline. Nissanka fails to get it away and the ball comes off the body, rolling into the leg side. A leg bye.

SIX! Picked up and dispatched into the crowd! Well short and angled into the batter, Kusal Mendis swivels on his toes and pulls it from around chest height and high up over the fence behind square leg for a biggie.
Takes pace off and bowls it full on off, Kusal Mendis drives it straight back and Taskin does well to stop it with an extended left boot. That will sting a bit.
FOUR! Poor delivery! Full and angling down leg, Mendis stays low and helps it off the pads and down to fine leg for another boundary, the fifth of the chase already.

On a hard length and outside off, tapped away in front of covers and wide of mid off for a single. However, Mohammad Naim from mid off runs after it and fumbles, allowing a second run. Excellent running!
Pitches it up full and around off, Mendis drives it away to mid on.
FOUR! Top shot! Just back of a length and outside off, Kusal Mendis stays put and taps it away to the right of point and gets it through for a boundary.
Short of a length and over middle, picked up by Kusal Mendis and hit away to deep square leg for a single. 14 off the first over of the chase.
Back of a length on off, just eased off the back foot and through the point region for a single.
Pitches it up, full on off, Nissanka blocks it back to the bowler.

FOUR! Aerial but hit well enough and Nissanka has light up the chase with a hat-trick iof boundaries. Full and wide, Pathum Nissanka goes after it and smacks it wide to the left of point for another boundary. Mohammad Saifuddin is all over the place right now.
FOUR! Easy pickings this time around. Short and on leg, pulled away off the hips and wide of short fine leg for another boundary. Nissanka off to a flier.

FOUR! A gorgeous shot to start the chase! Hard-length delivery around off, nothing wrong with it. Pathum Nissanka gets up on his toes and punches it crisply through the gap at covers and the ball races away to the fence.

Just a single to end proceedings here! Goes full and wide, Mohammad Naim leans on and crunches it away towards deep cover. The batters try and push for the second run but the fielder in the deep is quick to get to the ball. 11 off the final over and Bangladesh finish with 154/5 on the board!
A high full toss, wide of the off stump, Shamim backs away and smashes it flat to deep cover for a single. They want the second run but Shamim slips and it will only be a single.
SIX! Goes all the way and Bangladesh surpass the 150 mark! Too short and down leg, a bit slower again, this time Shamim Hossain waits well, stays low and swings it over fine leg for a biggie.

Nicely bowled! Thushara sees Shamim shaping up for the reverse and cleverly takes pace off, bowling it into the deck and around off. Shamim goes through with the shot but misses it completely. Also, Mohammad Naim has a word with the umpire and replays suggest that Naim was unhappy with Thushara fake fielding which the umpire probably didn't pick up.
Very full and angled in at the stumps, Naim gets cramped for room and digs it out down the ground for a single.
Slower yorker, well wide outside off, Naim reaches out and squeezes it to the left of point for a single where Maheesh Theekshana fails to pick it up on the slide and the batters pinch an extra run.
SIX! Wow, that has been nailed! Quick and full around off, Shamim Hossain brings out the reverse sweep and crunches it flat over deep backward point for a biggie.
Shorter and around off, Naim backs away and cuts it through point for one more.
Quick and flat around the top of off, Shamim Hossain looks to cut but gets an under egde over off stump and past the keeper for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Maheesh Theekshana fires back with a wicket, his second of the game and Bangladesh lose half their side now. Quicker again, full and on the stumps. Mehidy Hasan Miraz hangs back and looks to power it away over covers but miscues it towards cover. Charith Asalanka takes a few steps back and takes a simple catch. End of a fighting knock from MIraz as he departs for 29 (22).
Mehidy Hasan Miraz c C Asalanka b M Theekshana 29 (23b 4x4 0x6)
FOUR! Too full and wide, put away! A low full toss, wide outside off, Miraz reaches out and slices it away over backward point and picks up a much-needed boundary. That was bowled at almost 112 kph.
Fired in on middle and leg, Naim clears the front leg and heaves it away without much timing to long on for one.
Full again and at the stumps, Naim lofts the ball down the ground, to long off but just for a single.
Full and straight, in the blockhole, Mehidy Hasan Miraz looks to jam it out but gets an inside edge onto the pads and the batters scamper through for a single.
Beaten! Slow and short, well outside the off stump, Mehidy Hasan Miraz looks to cut but misses and no wide is called either as Miraz had moved along with the delivery.

Oh, that is some delivery! A perfect yorker around leg stump, dips late and Mohammad Naim can't even lay down a bat it time. The ball smashes into the boot and trickles down to fine leg for a leg bye.
FOUR! Easy pickings! Mohammad Naim shapes up to scoop and Nuwan Thushara serves a gentle full toss on off. Naim is able to get inside the line and ramps it over short fine leg for a single.
Pre-meditated from Miraz. Slower one around off, Miraz gets inside the line to scoop but misses. The ball goes off the pads to the leg side and they get a leg bye.
Tossed up outside off, driven away firmly to long off for a single.
Fuller in length and around off, Mehidy shapes up for the cut but adjusts and jams it wide of mid off.
Flatter one around off, Naim makes room and slaps it to deep point for a run.
Quicker and on off, pushed off the back foot and down to long on for one more.

At the stumps, clipped away in front of deep mid-wicket. The batters push hard for two and get it but there's a direct hit at the bowler's end and the third umpire is called in. Replays confirm that Naim was well in.
Flatter and pushed through quick on off, Naim is late but manages to jam it into the off side for a single.
FOUR! Well struck! Flighted ball around off, Mehidy Hasan Miraz goes down on one knee and slogs it aerially and in front of deep mid-wicket for a boundary.
Googly, bowled outside off, Mehidy looks to play it late but is well beaten.

EDGED AND DROPPED! Beautifully bowled and that is a difficult one for the keeper. Jeffrey Vandersay sees Mohammad Naim stepping out and slows it up, dragging the length back on off. It is the wrong'un and Naim goes through with the swing across the line, only to get an outside edge that goes high to the left of the keeper. Kusal Mendis can't react quickly and it goes through to short third for a single.
Floated up wide of the off stump, Mehidy drags the sweep along the ground and to deep mid-wicket for a single.
A googly now, on middle and angling in, Mehidy Hasan Miraz goes for the hard sweep and gets it off the inner half of the blade behind square leg. Two taken.
Nagging length around off, slower, Miraz waits back and plays it late but straight to short third.
Back of a length on middle, Miraz pushes it to long on for a single.
FOUR! Back-to-back boundaries! Back of a length, around off, Mehidy plays a controlled pull along the ground wide of deep square leg for four.

FOUR! This time Miraz gets some bat on it and gets four! Slower bouncer again, around off, Miraz again shuffles across a bit and looks to pull it and gets some bat on the ball as the ball takes the cue end of the bat and flies fine of the short fine leg fielder for four.
Slower bouncer outside off, Miraz shuffles across and looks to ramp it and misses as the ball goes just over his bat.
Slower back-of-a-length ball, on off, Naim pulls it on the bounce to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Slower full ball on off, Miraz drives it down the ground to the left of long off for a single.
Full toss, on middle and off, Miraz sweeps it towards deep backward square leg for a single.
Full on middle, Naim swings through the line and gets an bottom edge that goes along the ground to short third. Single taken.
Short on off, Mehidy rocks back and pulls it along the ground to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Short on middle, Miraz pushes it back to the bowler.
Full and outside off, Naim moves across and hits it towards long on for a single.

APPEAL FOR LBW AND GIVEN! That looks plumb. The only question is if it's pitching outside leg. Mohammad Naim goes for the review at the very last moment. Here's the third umpire. Nothing on UltraEdge. The Ball Tracking shows it to be pitching well outside leg. The on-field call will be changed. NOT OUT.
Slower full ball, outside off, Naim drives it to the left of short cover, and picks up a single.
Short ball outside off, Naim plays the tennis forehand to the left of long on and calls for two straight away.
Short ball outside off. Pulled through mid-wicket region for a single. Miraz is off the mark.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Length ball outside off, not that wide to be cut, as there was not enough width on offer. The length too was not that short to be cut. But Hridoy plays the cut and outside edges it to the right of the wicket-keeper, Kusal Mendis, who dives to his right and takes a fine catch.
Tawhid Hridoy c K Mendis b D Shanaka 10 (13b 0x4 0x6)
Length ball outside off, Naim cuts it along the ground to deep cover for a single.
Length ball on off, Hridoy smacks the pull along the ground to deep mid-wicket for a single.

Slower bouncer, around off, Naim thinks it's going over his head and leaves it alone. The ball goes on the bounce to the right of the wicket-keeper, who does well to stop it. Naim immediately looks at the square leg umpire, as he thinks it's a wide, but the umpire is unmoved.
Slower delivery well outside off, on a length, Hridoy guides it to wide deep third man for a single.
Length ball around off, Naim makes some room and cuts it toward deep third man for a single.
Full on middle, Hridoy drills it along the ground to long on for a single.
On a length and sliding down leg, Naim pulls it along the ground to deep backward square leg for a single.
Pace-off delivery that lands on that 8M-9M area, outside off, Hridoy steers it towards short third man and picks up a single.
Full and just outside off, Naim shuffles across to scoop it and misses. Just three runs off that over.
On a length on middle, Hridoy punches it down the ground to long on for a single.
Full on off, Hridoy looks to hit hard through the line, gets an inside edge which goes onto his pads and then behind the wicket. Dot ball.
Slower bouncer on off, Hridoy plays the tennis forehand smash to the left of deep mid-wicket and picks up two runs.
Good length and just outside off, again Hridoy goes for the cut and again is beaten on the shot. That's too close to cut!

Oh, Tawhid Hridoy beaten on the inside edge! Dasun Shanaka is appealing. The umpire is unmoved. Shanaka has a word with Kusal Mendis and they don't go for the review. A touch full and just outside off, Hridoy looks to cut it and gets beaten on the inside edge.
Flatter delivery angled across off, Naim waits and taps it late down to short third.

SIX! Goes all the way! Floated up around leg, too full, it is the attempted googly. Mohammad Naim goes for the slog sweep and hits it over the backward square leg fence for a biggie. A boundary after 27 balls.
Fractionally short around off, cut away off the back foot and straight to sweeper cover for one more run.
Flighted on off, Naim brings out the reverse sweep and gets it off the under edge to short third for only a single.
Full and on off, curving away, Hridoy makes a bit of room and slaps it way through point for one. The batters look for two but the fielder is quick to pounce on the ball.
A low full toss on middle and leg, Mohammad Naim gets down on one knee and sweeps it right off the legs and through square leg for a single.
Follows the batter down the leg side, does Theekshana. Naim works it away through mid-wicket for one.
Bowled flatter and at the batter, Hridoy stays back and tucks it 'round the corner on the leg side for one.

OUT! CAUGHT! Excellent take in the deep and Bangladesh lose two quick wickets here. Maheesh Theekshana bowls it just short of a full length and angles it in from around off. Parvez Hossain Emon looks to take it on but has to reach for it and one hand even comes off the handle. The ball goes a long way up in the air and towards long off. Dasun Shanaka comes in a bit before tracking back and takes a fine catch just over his head. Emon, the set-batter, departs for 38 (22) and Bangladesh are now 3 down.
Parvez Hossain Emon c D Shanaka b M Theekshana 38 (22b 5x4 1x6)
Fuller again and on the pads, nudged away towards square leg for a single.
Pushed through fuller and at the stumps, Naim lunges and pushes it to the left of the bowler looking for one but Theekshana gets across quickly and stops it.
Quick and short on leg, tucked away neatly behind square leg for a single.

OUT! LBW! A huge appeal and it is given out by the on-field umpire. Litton Das looks perplexed and has a word with the non-striker before taking the review. Another googly from Jeffrey Vandersay, not all that full and around off. Das looks to get inside the line and sweep it behind square leg but misses and gets hit on the pads. The third umpire is called in and there's nothing on UltraEdge. Ball Tracking shows the impact as Umpire's call and wickets as hitting. It stays out with the onfield call and Bangladesh are now 65/2 in 8 overs.
Litton Das (c) lbw J Vandersay 6 (11b 0x4 0x6)
Good running! Fractionally short on the stumps, hit away off the back foot and down to long on for a couple of runs.

FOUR BYES! Oh, that's gone right through everyone. Another wrong'un, bowled on a length and on off. This one dips and drifts in. Litton Das looks to play at it and but is beaten through the gate and the ball goes over the stumps, past the keeper and into the fence behind.
Flatter one, well outside off, Emon rocks back and cuts it away in front of the point region for a single.
A big googly, slower and angled across off. Parvez Hossain Emon looks to fetch and sweep but is well beaten.
Starts with a bit of a long hop, around middle, Das rocks back and pulls it away to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Length ball on the pads, Das misses the flick and gets it off the pads behind square leg. They get a leg bye.
Play and a miss! Short of a good length and outside off, Litton Das advances down the track and looks to loft it over covers but the ball just nibbles away and beats the outside edge.
Good length, around the top of off, blocked off.
Fuller in length and around off, Parvez Hossain Emon has a wild heave at it but miscues it completely over the point region and picks up a sigle.
Nicely bowled! Shanaka sees Parvez shaping up for the big shot and slides it across on a good length around off. Emon has to adjust and make the block.

Another risky single but Litton makes it! Back of a length and around off, Litton Das pats it down to mid off and scurries through for the single as the fielder misses the direct hit at the bowler's end.

Oh, a direct hit might have been interesting! Pace-off, and a tad short around off, Das pushes it straight to point and sets off for the single. The fielder has a shy at the keeper's end but misses as Parvez dives in to make his ground. Bangladesh end the Powerplay with 54/1!
Short of a good length over off, angling in, Emon looks to pull off the back foot but mistimes it towards mid-wicket for a run.
Slower one, back of a length and around off, Litton Das taps it down wide of point and picks up a single to get off the mark.
Hard length over middle, Das covers the line and blocks it off.
Excellent fielding! Back of a length and outside off, cut away hard and to the left of short third where Nuwan Thushara makes a half stop. The batters pick up a single.

FOUR! No let off from Parvez Hossain Emon even after the wicket. Fuller in length and outside off, Parvez throws his hands at the ball and smcks the drive through cover-point for a boundary. A fine flourish of the hands.

OUT! CAUGHT! FOUR AND A WICKET! Nuwan Thushara has his revenge! This one's an attempted yorker that dips on the batter, ends up being a low full toss. Tanzid is perhaps deceived by the dip, as he ends up pushing it in the air and straight to short mid-wicket, where Maheesh Theekshana takes a fairly simple catch.
Tanzid Hasan c M Theekshana b N Thushara 16 (17b 2x4 0x6)
FOUR! FLICKED FOR FOUR! Full on leg, Tanzid Hasan flicks this away, in the air towards the vacant deep mid-wicket region for a boundary.
Pace-off, on a fuller length, on off, Emon pushes it off the front foot towards long on. Single taken.
Slower back-of-a-length around off, Tanzid plays the pull, but doesn't time it whatsoever as he hits it off the splice of his bat and well short of deep square leg for a single.
Full on off, Emon pushes it wide of mid off and picks up a single.
Pace-off delivery, on a length, just outside off, Tanzid pushes it along the ground to long on for a single.
FOUR! BACK-TO-BACK BOUNDARIES! 14 off the over! Quick, full off break, on off, Parvez drives this one along the ground wide of short cover and picks up a boundary.
FOUR! SWEPT AND SWEPT HARD! A touch fuller on middle, Emon gets down on one knee as he sweeps this one fiercely through the square leg region for a boundary.
A touch short on middle leg, Tanzid works it through mid-wicket for a single.
Quicker, shorter on middle, carrom ball, Tanzid pushes at it and gets an inside edge that goes onto his pads and into the ground.

A touch short on middle, Emon flicks it straight to short fine leg. Tanzid Hasan calls for one and completes it just in time as he dives. The wicket-keeper does whip off the bails, but Tanzid Hasan is just in.

FOUR! Welcome into the attack Maheesh Theekshana! That is hammered as straight as an arrow. This is a yorker on off, Parvez Hossain Emon is sitting deep in his crease, drives this back into the deck as the ball then lobs over the umpire's head and runs away to the fence.
Back of a length on off, Tanzid Hasan looks to pull it but gets it off the toe end of the bat as he ends up playing it towards mid on. Dot ball.
Length ball outside off, Tanzid Hasan looks to slog it and gets beaten on the inside edge.
Full and just outside off, Emon eases the square drive to the left of deep point and picks up a single.
Length ball wide outside off, Emon throws his bat at that one and doesn't connect as the ball was too wide. Wide given.
SIX! NAILED IT! Pace off delivery on a length, on off, Emon picks the bones out of it as he plays the pick up shot over deep mid-wicket for a six.
Back-of-a-length delivery that sticks in the surface a bit, Emon is already through the pull as he gets beaten.

Back of a length, outside off, Tanzid Hasan skips down the track and crunches the square cut to the left of cover-point, who dives to his left and saves potential three runs. That was hit hard and Jeffrey Vandersay did well to stop it. Single taken.
Full and outside off, Tanzid Hasan drives it to the right of short cover and picks up a single to keep the strike.
On a length on off, Hasan skips down the track and hits it straight to mid on, who is standing right on the edge of the 30 yard ring.
Again overpitched on middle, Hasan pushes it back to the bowler.
Full on off, Hasan drives it straight to mid off.

FOUR! Beautiful hit from Tanzid Hasan! Full on middle, Tanzid plays the straight drive. He doesn't hit it too hard but timing on that one was sublime. The mid off fielder runs to his left and puts in the dive, but the ball evades him. Maheesh Theekshana at mid on runs behind the ball and puts in the dive near the ropes and tries to push the ball inside, but eventually the ball manages to trickle into the ropes.
Short of a length on middle, Hasan works it off the back foot to the left of deep square leg for two runs.
Back of a length on middle, Hasan pulls it as he hits it on the bounce to deep square leg for a single to get off the mark.
Back of a length on off, Hasan pushes it to short cover.

A touch full again on off, Emon drives this one to the left of cover point who is quick to get to his left and make the stop. Jeffrey Vandersay doesn't collect it properly which allows the batters to take the single.
Full and outside off, Emon leans into the square drive as he hits it to the left of deep point and picks up two runs.

FOUR! Parvez Hossain Emon and Bangladesh are off and running! Back of a length again, this time outside off, Emon sees width on offer and plays the pull hard and handsome over short mid-wicket as he gets his first boundary.

Back of a length to start with from Chamika Karunaratne. The line is in on off. The ball hits high on Parvez Hossain Emon's bat and goes towards short mid-wicket, who is quick to run in front and collect the ball. Parvez Hossain Emon wanted a single but is sent back.
